meanings.definition: To adapt a story or script for filming.
meanings.sent1: I will cinematize the book into a movie.
meanings.sent2: The director decided to cinematize the novel for the big screen.
meanings.sent3: She wanted to cinematize the play, but with a twist.
meanings.sent4: His imagination cinematized the mundane events into an epic tale.
meanings.sent5: The filmmaker's goal was to cinematize the script with creativity and flair.

meanings.definition: To give a cinematic quality to something.
meanings.sent1: The special effects will cinematize the scene.
meanings.sent2: The lighting was used to cinematize the atmosphere of the film.
meanings.sent3: The artist tried to cinematize the painting by adding depth.
meanings.sent4: Her words cinematized the listener's imagination.
meanings.sent5: The music score helped to cinematize the emotional impact of the movie.

meanings.definition: To make a film or movie.
meanings.sent1: They plan to cinematize the story next month.
meanings.sent2: The production company will cinematize the script in Hollywood.
meanings.sent3: He wanted to cinematize his dream project for years.
meanings.sent4: The team worked hard to cinematize the documentary before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The director's vision was to cinematize the entire series for the audience.
